entries.name: OPENSSL_FIPS
entries.desc:
Boolean indicating whether OpenSSL is
FIPS-capable or not

entries.name: OPENSSL_VERSION
entries.desc: Version of OpenSSL the ruby OpenSSL extension was built with

entries.name: OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER
entries.desc: Version number of OpenSSL the ruby OpenSSL extension was built with (base 16)

entries.name: Digest(name)
entries.desc: Returns a Digest subclass by name

entries.name: debug → true | falseclick to toggle source
debug = boolean → booleanclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Turns on or off debug mode. With debug mode, all erros added to the OpenSSL error queue will be printed to stderr.

entries.name: errors → [String...]click to toggle source
entries.desc: See any remaining errors held in queue.

entries.name: fips_mode → true | falseclick to toggle source
fips_mode = boolean → booleanclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Turns FIPS mode on or off. Turning on FIPS mode will obviously only have an effect for FIPS-capable installations of the OpenSSL library. Trying to do so otherwise will result in an error.

entries.name: mem_check_start → nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Calls CRYPTO_mem_ctrl(CRYPTO_MEM_CHECK_ON). Starts tracking memory allocations. See also ::print_mem_leaks.

entries.name: print_mem_leaks → true | falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: For debugging the Ruby/OpenSSL library. Calls CRYPTO_mem_leaks_fp(stderr). Prints detected memory leaks to standard error. This cleans the global state up thus you cannot use any methods of the library after calling this.
